body.p: Reactor Power Panels (RPPs) make maintenance of downstream equipment safer by limiting fault current and reducing the risk of arc flash. The Current-Limiting Reactor (2000A or 2500A) is designed to be used as part of a reserve power source for multiple downstream RPPs with Bypass Cabinets. An Current-Limiting Reactor, when used as a component of a reserve power source, allows multiple downstream RPPs to be taken offline for maintenance while the Current-Limiting Reactor temporarily provides the same safety benefits as the offline RPPs.
